title: "META HAS PROMOTED HOMOPHOBIC, RACIST, AND FAKE NEWS POSTS" - YouTube
snippet: Elisabetta Piccolotti mentions a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino that showed how META favored homophobic, racist, or fake news posts at the expense of politicians' content. The study indicated that Meta applied a filter between 2021 and 2024 that reduced the visibility of official political posts by 72% while increasing the visibility of extreme right-wing influencer posts with racist, homophobic, and hateful messages, and often fake news.
description: A YouTube video titled "META HAS PROMOTED HOMOPHOBIC, RACIST, AND FAKE NEWS POSTS" mentions a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino regarding META's content filtering practices between 2021 and 2024.

title: Giornata Internazionale di Studi - Can the Damage of Destructive Polarization Be Repaired?
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, along with Giada Marino and Bruna Almeida Paroni (all from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo), is listed as a speaker at the conference. They will be presenting on "The Brazilian Digital Battlefield: Investigating The Dynamics Of Political Information Campaigns In Post-Bolsonaro Era," focusing on misinformation campaigns on Facebook during Brazil's political shifts.
description: Fabio Giglietto is listed as a speaker at the "Giornata Internazionale di Studi" conference at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, presenting on misinformation campaigns in Brazil's political shifts, which aligns with his expertise.

title: Massimo Terenzi and Fabio Giglietto , Author at European Journalism Observatory - EJO
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is co-author with Massimo Terenzi at the European Journalism Observatory (EJO) on an article examining the role of EU's Digital Services Act in enabling platform transparency and whether these changes will actually help researchers.
description: Fabio Giglietto co-authored an article with Massimo Terenzi at the European Journalism Observatory (EJO) examining the role of the EU's Digital Services Act in enabling platform transparency and its impact on researchers.

title: “META HAS PROMOTED HOMOPHOBIC, RACIST, AND FAKE NEWS POSTS” - YouTube
snippet: Elisabetta Piccolotti mentions a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino, which demonstrated how Meta has favored homophobic, racist, or outright fake news posts at the expense of political content. This is framed as a way American Big Tech companies influence elections worldwide.
description: This YouTube video features Elisabetta Piccolotti discussing a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino, which revealed Meta's promotion of harmful content over political content, suggesting an influence on elections.

title: L’articolo 21 nella gabbia di Facebook - Terzogiornale
Researchers meet to discuss DSA access to publicly available platform data
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, Italy, is listed as one of the European experts who met with ECAT and DG Connect in November to share progress on their projects related to systemic risks, as part of the Digital Services Act (DSA).
description: This European Commission news item mentions Fabio Giglietto, from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, Italy, as one of the experts who participated in a meeting about DSA access to platform data and systemic risks, which aligns with his expertise in social media research and disinformation studies.

title: Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Conference Agenda - | Association of Internet Researchers
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is listed as the chair of a session at the Association of Internet Researchers conference.
description: The content is a conference agenda from the Association of Internet Researchers (AoIR) 2025, where Fabio Giglietto is listed as a session chair. This indicates his involvement and recognition within the internet research community.

title: Cambio di Rotta - Cap3: La Fluidità del Voto in Italia 2022 - Studocu
